description.narrative: 1. Building and equipping of the CMP anthropological laboratory 2. Numbers of new remains of missing persons exhumed, analyzed and returned to their relatives

comment.narrative: A total of 502 Turkish Cypriots and 1493 Greek Cypriots were officially reported as missing by both communities. CMP's objective is to exhume, identify and return remains of people listed as missing to their families.
Contributing to the results set for the CMP-7.
Achieved.

title.narrative: New Nicosia Waste Water Treatment Plant

description.narrative: The project for the new Nicosia Waste Water Treatment Plant aims to promote and facilitate access to wastewater services to both communities of Nicosia as a fundamental contribution to the on-going peace and confidence building process.

title.narrative: Support to cultural heritage monuments, Phase I

description.narrative: This project aims at contributing to the confidence building process through the preservation of Cypriot cultural heritage island wide according to the strategy of the Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage.

title.narrative: Project Document of "Support to cultural heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus, Phase I
Support to cultural heritage monuments, Phase I
Support to cultural heritage monuments, Phase I

description.narrative: Support to Cultural Heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus, Phase 1.
independent political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness
Othello Tower emergency works completed Other 5 Cultural Heritage site emergency works completed Visibility/completion ceremonies are organized for each completed project

comment.narrative: 11 Cultural Heritage sites selected within the agreed Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage bi-communal list. Selected cultural heritage sites in derelict conditions.

T1 - Bi-communal monitoring visits to project sites are organized and facilitated regularly (at least one every two months) T2 - Conservation works completed and project completion ceremonies organized in 4 cultural heritage sites

T1 - Achieved: One bi-communal monitoring visits to project sites organized every month. T2 - Achieved: Conservation works and project completion ceremonies organized bringing together Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots in Othello Tower in Famagusta (July 2015), Paphos Hamam (March 2015), Evretou/Evretu Mosque (March 2015), Tzerkezoi/Cerkez Mosque (March 2015), Profitis Elia Church in Philia/Serhatkoy (17 November 2015).

title.narrative: Support for cultural heritage monuments - Phase II

description.narrative: Preservation of Cypriot cultural heritage through conservation and emergency measures for high importance cultural heritage sites agreed by the bi-communal Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage in Cyprus.

title.narrative: Project Document of "Support to cultural heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus, Phase II

description.narrative: Support for the cultural heritage monuments of great importance for the communities of Cyprus.
independent political entity
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness
- 2 cultural heritage sites to benefit from emergency measures - 8 sites to benefit from conservation designs and/or conservation works

comment.narrative: Study of Cultural Heritage Support to cultural heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus - Phase 1 List of sites identified by the strategy note of the Technical Committee on Cultural Heritage

T1- Bi-communal monitoring visits to project sites organised and facilitated regularly (at least one per month) T2 - Conservation works completed in at least 2 cultural heritage sites T3 - Tendering process completed for conservation works at Agios Panteleimonas Monastery

T1- Achieved: One bi-communal monitoring visits/month organised T2 - Achieved: Conservation works completed in Agios Afksentios Church (May 2015), Old St.George Church (14 November 2015), Watermill/Aqueduct in Chrysochou/Hirsofu (Expected completion date: December 2015) T3 - Tendering process completed for conservation works at Agios Panteleimonas Monastery.

title.narrative: Restoration of the Holy Monastery of Apostolos Andreas

description.narrative: The restoration of this very important religious monument intends to contribute to the on-going confidence-building process between the Greek Cypriots and Turkish Cypriots communities within the context of cultural heritage preservation and protection.

title.narrative: Project Document_Restoration of Apostolos Andreas Monastery

description.narrative: Restoration of the Monastery of Apostolos Andreas
Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness

Restoration of the Church & the adjacent buildings completed
Specialised restoration of the iconostasis and other immovable objects which are an inherent part of the church.
Geotechnical investigations & tests carried out.

comment.narrative:
In view of the complicated political situation prevailing in Cyprus, the United Nations has a special role to play in fostering an environment for progress to be made towards an eventual settlement of the Cyprus question.
The Technical Committee on the Cultural Heritage established an “Advisory Board for the Preservation, Physical Protection and Restoration of the Immovable Cultural Heritage of Cyprus”
Additionally, TCCH has assumed the role of the coordination and facilitation for the restoration of the Apostolos Andreas Monastery.
The project will be implemented according to the project prepared by the University of Patras in 2007.

At least 60% of restoration completed Supervision of works according to contract conditions/to carry out the necessary inspections of the Civil Works/ testing and acceptance Bi-communal site visits organized on quarterly basis At least one bi-communal media site visit organized
All Achieved. Bi-communal media site visit planned for 23rd October 2015.

title.narrative: Natura 2000 – Completion of Nature Protection Facilities

description.narrative: Natura 2000 – Completion of Nature Protection Facilities

title.narrative: PROJECT DOCUMENT OF "Natura 2000 – Completion of Nature Protection Facilities"

description.narrative: Natura 2000 – Completion of Nature Protection Facilities

Construction of nature protection facilities is completed in three sites identified by the European Commission as potential Natura 2000 sites, namely: Karpasia/Karpaz, Alakati/Alagadi, Agia Eirini/Ayairini/Akdeniz.

comment.narrative: Construction was initiated by the European Commission in 2011. The status of the existing buildings in the three sites at the beginning of the projectsimilar; concrete structures are completed, walls are partially completed and some piping for electrical and plumbing have been completed.
T1 - Designs review and preparation of new tender documents
T1 - Ongoing - design review expected to be completed by November 2015.

title.narrative: Support for the cultural heritage monuments - Phase III

description.narrative: Support to monuments of great importance to Cyprus - Phase III

title.narrative: Project Document of "Support to cultural heritage monuments of great importance for Cyprus, Phase III"
Support for the cultural heritage monuments - Phase III
Support for the cultural heritage monuments - Phase III
Support for the cultural heritage monuments - Phase III
Support for the cultural heritage monuments - Phase III

description.narrative: Support to monuments of great importance to Cyprus - Phase III

The following cultural heritage sites are envisaged to benefit from Conservation/Emergency Measures works under Phase 3 of the project:
Karpasia/Karpaz Region: - Agios Georgios Church - Afendrika archaeological site - Agios Philon Church - Agia Triada Church
Paphos region: - Hasan Aga Bath/Hamam - Minaret of Ebubekir mosque
Famagusta region: - St. Anne Church - St. Mary Churh - Carmelite Church - Ravelin (Phase 2 – conservation works)
Archaengelos Michail Church in Lefkonoiko/Gecitkale Mosque in Agios Ioannis/Ayanni Mosque in Agios Nicolaos/Aynikola Conservation works at Agios Panteleimonas Monastery

comment.narrative: Support to monuments of great importance to Cyprus - Phase I and Support to monuments of great importance to Cyprus - Phase II.

T1 - Preparation of Terms of Reference for Solicitations for the following cultural heritage sites: a) Paphos cluster (Hasan Aga Bath/Hamam and Minaret of Ebubekir mosque) b) Martinengo Cluster (St. Anne church of Maronites, St. Mary church of Armenians, St Mary of Carmel (Carmelite church), and the Mescit of Tabakhane/Tanner’s Mosque (Jacobite Church). c) Karpaz Cluster (Agios Georgios Church, Afendrika archaeological site, Agios Philon Church, Agia Triada Church) d) Archangelos Michail Church T2- Contracting for designs for at least two of the above

T1- Achieved: all ToRs have been finalised T2 - Achieved: Designs contracts signed for Archangelos Michail Church (July 2015), for Martinengo Cluster - 4 sites (August 2015) and for Karpasia/Karpaz and Paphos cluster (November 2015).

title.narrative: Support to the Committee on Missing Persons (EC-7)

description.narrative: Support to the Committee on Missing Persons' Project on Exhumation, Identification and Return of Remains of Missing Persons in Cyprus, Phase VII

title.narrative: PROJECT DOCUMENT OF "SUPPORT TO THE COMMITTEE ON MISSING PERSONS’ PROJECT ON EXHUMATION, IDENTIFICATION AND RETURN OF REMAINS OF MISSING PERSONS IN CYPRUS, PHASE VII"
Support to the Committee on Missing Persons (EC-7)

description.narrative: Support to the Committee on Missing Persons' Project on Exhumation, Identification and Return of Remains of Missing Persons in Cyprus, Phase VII
A number of missing persons returned to their relatives from the total number of 2,700 missing from both communities.

comment.narrative: CMP (EC-6)

50 Greek Cypriot and Turkish Cypriot scientists (anthropologists, archaeologists, geologist, psychologists, geneticists, investigators, photographers, workers and bulldozer drivers) working together at burial sites located all over the island in order to exhume human remains and at the CMP Anthropological Laboratory carrying out anthropological analysis of the remains under the coordination of two Cypriot Team Leaders.
185 days of excavation works (digging of wells, trenching, sieving) have been carried out.
100 bones/bone fragments will have been handled at the CMP Anthropological Laboratory.
CMP website is maintained to keep the general public and the families informed.
CMP supported the relatives of the missing persons’ associations contact with each other and with related associations in Europe and other parts of the world.
Regular and/or ad hoc audits / reviews of the CMP program and on-site training of CMP scientists by consultants/experts (for example, geneticists specialised in mass disasters and /or degraded DNA, archaeologists and forensic anthropologists).
Participation of CMP scientists (anthropologists, archaeologists, geneticists) in specialized training abroad.
Operations staff recruited by UNDP.
Achieved.
